title: Besu did not Participate in Sync Committees Post-Merge

labels.name: TeamGroot
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Groot Team

body:
A Validator was selected for Sync Committee attestions.

During this time frame, Teku would not participate in the Sync Committee's but other validator's would still attest normally.

Work-around was to revert back to Geth which started participating in the SC's immediately. 

# Besu Log File
```
[propulsion@lnx1 ~]$ journalctl -u mn_besu --since='2022-09-15 09:45:00' --until "2022-09-15 11:00:00" | grep -i error -A25 -B2
Sep 15 09:56:36 lnx1.eth1.phx1 besu[603287]: 2022-09-15 09:56:36.163-04:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineForkchoiceUpdated | VALID for fork-choice-update: head: 0xd9c0c7ded1503159431719067dbaea30d06bc9c62f0f4825ecc29e7402663653, finalized: 0x3b53713a824db2014d0ae785604a66ea8516bb4fe63a0d1223b5da45a104577f, safeBlockHash: 0x965c182a59c81bce2b6e067fd95e55745e20accc620196dd3c14cf72b435980d

# Teku Log File
```
[propulsion@lnx1 ~]$ journalctl -u mn_teku --since=today | grep 'Sync committee performance'
Sep 15 10:08:23 lnx1.eth1.phx1 teku[605520]: 10:08:23.933 INFO  - Sync committee performance: epoch 146944, expected 32, produced 0, correct 0, included 0 (0%)
Sep 15 10:14:47 lnx1.eth1.phx1 teku[605520]: 10:14:47.980 INFO  - Sync committee performance: epoch 146945, expected 32, produced 0, correct 0, included 0 (0%)
Sep 15 10:21:12 lnx1.eth1.phx1 teku[605520]: 10:21:12.154 INFO  - Sync committee performance: epoch 146946, expected 32, produced 0, correct 0, included 0 (0%)
Sep 15 10:27:36 lnx1.eth1.phx1 teku[605520]: 10:27:36.029 INFO  - Sync committee performance: epoch 146947, expected 32, produced 0, correct 0, included 0 (0%)
Sep 15 10:33:59 lnx1.eth1.phx1 teku[605520]: 10:33:59.951 INFO  - Sync committee performance: epoch 146948, expected 32, produced 0, correct 0, included 0 (0%)
```

@Propulsions Would you be able to include the full Teku and Besu logs for the time period in which are seeing the sync committee performance error? The Besu logs are for of a different time period than the Teku logs you have included.

@jframe 

I have the flag `--log-include-events-enabled=false \` in my Teku config which substantially limits logging.

The Sync Committee starts at **Epoch 146944** which is Thu Sep 15 2022 10:01:36 GMT-0400 (EDT)

The first indication of this event in Teku is at 10:08:23 with attestations from the validators being produced but not the sync committee. There are no anomalies pre sync committee. 

# Teku
```
10:08:23.933 INFO  - Sync committee performance: epoch 146944, expected 32, produced 0, correct 0, included 0 (0%)
10:14:47.980 INFO  - Attestation performance: epoch 146944, expected (num of val), produced (num of val), included (num of val) (100%), distance 1 / 1.00 / 1, correct target (num of val) (100%), correct head (num of val) (100%)
```

# Besu
During this timeframe Besu appears operational aside from the earlier error occurring at 2022-09-15 09:56:36.163-04:00

```

Hmm, there's really not much to go on based on those logs. A couple of things that would be useful.  If you're still in the sync committee, enabling those event logs would be extremely helpful so we can see what's actually going on.

The other thing to check is that the teku logs your looking at are the full logs.  By default teku splits logs between the console and the log file with mostly just the events logs you've disabled going to console.  If you've set `--log-destination CONSOLE` then everything will go to the console, but otherwise it's worth looking for extra logs under you data dir in `logs/teku.log`.

@ajsutton @jframe

Please note, I ran into the WorldState error at Merge until restarting services at roughly 8:00 AM this morning post-merge.

Again, let me know if anything additional is needed. Thanks!

Ok so the key thing is that when the VC was trying to create the sync signature the beacon node had already imported a block for a later slot (the vc and bn are separate components even when run in the same process), so it gets:
```
Chain head has advanced beyond slot
```

It's not entirely clear why that happened but the logs show the validator client wound up catching up and producing sync messages correctly again.  That may be tied up with some of the performance issues we've seen with teku and are still investigating though it's not the normal symptoms we get.  We'll have to dig into in more depth to know exactly what's happened but at this stage I don't think it's a besu issue and we'll probably pick this up from the teku side to investigate further.

Sounds good. It was a toss up between Besu and Teku but assumed Besu since after syncing Geth, the attestations and committee rewards were going through. 

Thanks again.
Since this looks like a Teku issue have created a Teku issue for this https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/issues/6212
@Propulsions Going to close this ticket since we have https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/issues/6212 to look at this on the Teku side.
